Seccubus moved from SourceForge to GitHub

27 August 2012

The last few days I’ve moved the Seccubus sources, binary downloads and open tickets from SourceForge to GitHub.

Seccubs can Now be found here (and v1 here)

Why?

There are three reasons why I moved to GitHub:

  • The company I work from, Schuberg Philis, is participating into open source software more and more and uses GitHub
  • Git has advantages over SVN
  • SourceForge stopped supporting hosted apps and Seccubus used Trac as our bug tracker

How?

The migration wasn’t too bad. For the source code migration I used the git2svn tool and this guide. For the Trac tickets I decided to do a manual migration.

What’s next?

Business as usual.

Releasing Seccubus-2.0beta6 – The final beta Oops I did it again – Seccubus 2.0.beta5 released
